intro: Crotalaria pycnostachya subsp. donaldsonii, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers arranged in dense spikes, which are typical of the Crotalaria genus. It has a fibrous root system and is often found in disturbed soils, making it an adaptable species in various habitats. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and potentially useful in agricultural or medicinal contexts.
